Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: two black-figure friezes; above, rear of bull to left and of lion to right; blob rosette fill; below, separated by single band, lotus flower and bud chain with red on petals, outside leaves of lotus, and on collars; below, band and glazed lower wall..
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.571.a, 1888,0601.571.c, 1888,0601.572 and 1965,0930.803.
One of lotus buds has the 'ice-cream cone' design more often seen on North Ionian black-figured vases.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0133) (Phase 1)
